entries.femaleVariant: V, it's good you're here.
My deepest condolences – he was a fine boy.
Among the membership of the Night City Devils boxing club, we had this saying.
Then go raise a glass to him, Padre. A few glasses.
I, uh... I often think back to the first time me and Jack met.
It feels like it happened a century ago. At another time, in another place. Jackie saved my life.
entries.maleVariant: Feels like it happened a century ago. At another time, in another place. Jackie saved my life.

entries.femaleVariant: He'd bought some goods klepped from Arasaka. Top secret, priceless... a lizard, heh.
entries.maleVariant: He'd bought some goods klepped from Arasaka. Top secret, priceless... Heheheh, a lizard.

entries.femaleVariant: I thank you all for coming today.
Instead, I'll tell you a story.
[Drink]
I'm not going to tell you what kind of man my son was or lament about how much I miss him.
Make your best friends among the fighters who knock you out cold.
<kiroshi l="mex" o="Me mandó Campo Orta." t="Campo Orta sent me." b="" a=""/>
[Pour drink into fire]
I'm glad you're here. It was a beautiful ofrenda we gave him.
<kiroshi l="mex" o="De acuerdo." t="Agreed. I'll do just that." b="" a=""/>
We're about to start.
When he was about... nineteen years old?
Jackie was in the Valentinos. They were at war with Maelstrom back then.
I get a call from the hospital. They tell me he got shot. Three times. Just by the heart.
<mothertongue l="mex" m="pulpo" b="He was conscious when I get there. So many tubes coming out of him, he look like a... like a " a=", like an octopus or something."/>
<mothertongue l="mex" m="No te preocupes mamá." b="He tell me, he said, \"" a=" Look, I'm bulletproof. Nothing bad'll ever happen to me.\" "/>
And when I go, he take off his Valentinos ring. He swear he won't need it anymore.
But he was not scared. He just didn't want me to worry.
<kiroshi l="mex" o="Hm. Descansa en paz, mi hijo." t="Hm. Rest in peace, my son." b="" a=""/>
And it's true. Jackie's arm was a cannon. No one's ever hit me as hard – heh, I can still almost feel it.
Twelve rounds, buddy.

<kiroshi l="mex" o="Lamenta no estar aquí, todavía le quedan cuatro años que cumplir. Me pidió que leyera esto." t="He's sorry he can't be here – still has four years to serve. He asked me to read this." b="" a=""/>
<kiroshi l="mex" o="«Recuerdo cuando Jackie se nos unió. Era un niño fuerte»." t="\"I remember when Jackie first came to us. He was a tough kid.\" " b="" a=""/>

<kiroshi l="mex" o="«Cuando decía que iba a hacer algo, cumplía. Tenía honor. Podría haber llegado lejos»." t="\"When he said he would do something, he did it. He had honor. He would've made it far.\" " b="" a=""/>
<kiroshi l="mex" o="«Mis condolencias a la familia»." t="\"My condolences to the family.\" " b="" a=""/>
<kiroshi l="mex" o="«Que descanse en paz»." t="\"May he rest in peace.\" " b="" a=""/>
Jackie Welles.
[Set down ball] A Heywood kid with ambition...
[Set down tequila] He always wanted more out of life...
Rest easy, choom.
Thank you for your kind words, V.
D'you know what? You're a good woman.
entries.maleVariant: You know what? You're a good man.

entries.femaleVariant: [Take keys] Thank you.
You sure?
Thank you. I'll take such good care of it.
Uh... you sure?
And then, years later in Night City, he saved it again. At a time when I thought I'd lost absolutely everything.
I found my own freedom, then. But it would not have happened without him.
Half an hour later we were eatin' dinner at Mama Welles'. Turned out to have more in common than we thought – principles.
entries.maleVariant: Half an hour later... well, we're eatin' dinner at Mama Welles'. Turned out to have more in common than we thought – principles.

entries.femaleVariant: And I remember what he said then. That I came from a place where everyone's family, so he must be, too.
I would like to say a toast.
<kiroshi l="mex" o="Por mi hijo." t="Here's to my son" b="" a=""/>
Jackie would want you to have this.
<kiroshi l="mex" o="Cuídate, V." t="Take care of yourself, V." b="" a=""/>
Jackie'd kill me if I got so much as a scratch on it.
So don't get any scratches on it.
Then some badges showed up. Beat the shit out of both of us – half my fault, half his. We hightailed it out together.
entries.maleVariant: Then some badges showed up. Beat the shit out of us both – it's half my fault, half his. And we hightailed it out together.

entries.femaleVariant: It all started when he put a heater to my head.
I'd been hired to drive him and some contraband across the border.
She was very important to him.
Her name is Misty.
Let it go, Mama Welles.
What...?
Let it go, Mama Welles.
Excuse me?
She's a good woman, and your son loved her.
The best friend you could ask for, loyal to a fault.
entries.maleVariant: Best friend you could ask for, loyal to a fault.

entries.femaleVariant: His friends were everything.
He had principles.
An honorable man. He placed principles first and stuck hard to 'em.
Once he set his mind on something, he was ready to die to achieve it.
entries.maleVariant: Once he set his mind to something, he was ready to die to achieve it.

entries.femaleVariant: He did not fear life.
<mothertongue l="mex" m="Chica" b="He... He once told me, \"" a=", the one thing we can't do is be afraid of others.\" "/>
entries.maleVariant: <mothertongue l="mex" m="Bróder" b="He once told me, \"" a=", the one thing we can't do is be afraid of others.\" "/>

entries.femaleVariant: He wasn't who people thought he was.
Jackie loved life and had no fear. Heart on his sleeve, he... he didn't overthink things, he just went for it.
entries.maleVariant: Jackie loved life and had no fear. Heart on his sleeve, he didn't overthink things. He just went for it.

entries.femaleVariant: Everyone saw Jackie as a grinning charmer who saw the good in everyone, everything.
Thought he was bulletproof and that he'd become legend at the Afterlife.
entries.maleVariant: Thought he was bulletproof and... and that he'd become legend at the Afterlife.

entries.femaleVariant: And ultimately, he did what he set out to do – shit in the shoes of some powerful people.
If he's watching, bet just about now he's flippin' 'em all the bird.
entries.maleVariant: And if he's watching, I bet just about now he's flippin' 'em all the bird.

entries.femaleVariant: They were wrong. Jackie Welles was a helluvan ambitious choom who never gave up, and whose drive cost him his life.
entries.maleVariant: But they were wrong. Jackie Welles was a helluvan ambitious choom who never gave up, and whose drive cost him his life.

entries.femaleVariant: But he did in life what he said he'd do – reached for fortune and fame, no fear in his eyes or heart.
entries.maleVariant: But he did in life what he said he'd do – reached for fortune and fame, no fear in eyes or heart.

entries.femaleVariant: <mothertongue l="mex" m="putita" b="Lot of people come today... Even that " a=" Jackie was messing around with."/>
Misty. She was very important to him. Do you understand?
entries.maleVariant: Misty. And she was very important to him. Do you understand?

entries.femaleVariant: Go, invite her along for dinner. It's the least she deserves.
[Set down belt] He wasn't afraid of anyone...
[Recite passage from book]
Anyone else...?
A Heywood kid with a helluva drive.
He always wanted more than he got outta life.
He feared no one. And wasn't afraid. Lived life to the fullest.
entries.maleVariant: He feared no one. And wasn't afraid. He lived life to the fullest.

entries.femaleVariant: "When you go to war as a boy, you have a great illusion of immortality. Other people get killed, not you... Then, when you are badly wounded the first time, you lose that illusion."
He aimed high.
Always hungry for more. And never gave up, not once.
Never forgot where he came from.
He put his loved ones first.
Always, always knew what he wanted.
He kept Heywood in his heart, always. It made him who he was.
But most importantly…
For his loved ones, he'd sacrifice his life, without hesitation.
He always knew what he wanted. And took it without askin'.
entries.maleVariant: He always knew what he wanted. And he took it without askin'.

entries.femaleVariant: It's so, so good to see you.
Jackie chose his friends well.
[Sit]
[Stand] Always go back to the time we first met.
[Stand and say nothing]
Sit down, please.
I can't accept this.
Thank you, but... I really can't accept this.
I hope you can understand…
